meanings.definition: To write or inscribe letters on something again.
meanings.sent1: I need to reletter the sign with the correct spelling.
meanings.sent2: She decided to reletter the invitation to make it more legible.
meanings.sent3: After the rain washed away the address, she had to reletter the package.
meanings.sent4: The artist had to reletter the ancient manuscript to preserve its beauty.
meanings.sent5: He carefully relettered the faded love note to surprise his wife.

meanings.sent1: I will reletter the lost letter to ensure it reaches its destination.
meanings.sent2: She forgot to include an important detail, so she had to reletter the message.
meanings.sent3: He had to reletter the apology after realizing he forgot to sign it.
meanings.sent4: The post office had to reletter the damaged envelope for proper delivery.
meanings.sent5: She quickly relettered the returned mail with the correct address.

meanings.definition: To change the letters on something.
meanings.sent1: The graphic designer had to reletter the logo to match the new brand colors.
meanings.sent2: She decided to reletter the title of the book for a more modern look.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to reletter the classroom alphabet to include both upper and lower case letters.
meanings.sent4: The calligrapher was hired to reletter the wedding invitations with elegant script.
meanings.sent5: He carefully relettered the store sign to attract more customers.
